title: H01-1049

sentences.text: Listen-Communicate-Show -LRB- LCS -RRB- is a new paradigm for human interaction with data sources .
We integrate a spoken language understanding system with intelligent mobile agents that mediate between users and information sources .
We have built and will demonstrate an application of this approach called LCS-Marine .
Using LCS-Marine , tactical personnel can converse with their logistics system to place a supply or information request .
The request is passed to a mobile , intelligent agent for execution at the appropriate database .
Requestors can also instruct the system to notify them when the status of a request changes or when a request is complete .
We have demonstrated this capability in several field exercises with the Marines and are currently developing applications of this technology in new domains .

Entity-listen-communicate-show.label: Listen-Communicate-Show
Entity-listen-communicate-show.description: Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) is a novel interaction paradigm that combines spoken language understanding with intelligent mobile agents to facilitate user communication with data sources.

Entity-lcs-marine.label: LCS-Marine
Entity-lcs-marine.description: LCS-Marine is a software application that enables tactical personnel to interact with their logistics system through spoken language, allowing them to place supply or information requests which are executed by intelligent mobile agents.

Entity-lcs.label: LCS
Entity-lcs.description: LCS stands for Listen-Communicate-Show, which is a new paradigm designed to enhance human interaction with data sources through the integration of spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents.

Entity-this_capability.label: this capability
Entity-this_capability.description: This capability refers to the demonstrated ability of the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) system to facilitate human interaction with data sources through spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents, specifically in the context of logistics and supply requests during field exercises with the Marines.

Entity-this_approach.label: this approach
Entity-this_approach.description: This approach refers to the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) methodology, which integrates spoken language understanding with intelligent mobile agents to facilitate human interaction with data sources.

Entity-application_of_this_technology.label: applications of this technology
Entity-application_of_this_technology.description: The term 'applications of this technology' refers to the various uses and implementations of the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) paradigm, particularly in enhancing human interaction with data sources through spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents in diverse fields beyond military logistics.

Entity-information_request.label: information request
Entity-information_request.description: An information request refers to a query made by tactical personnel within the LCS-Marine system to obtain supplies or data from a logistics system, facilitated through spoken language interaction with intelligent mobile agents.

Entity-request.label: request
Entity-request.description: The request refers to a supply or information inquiry made by tactical personnel using the LCS-Marine application, which is processed by a mobile intelligent agent for execution in a database.

Entity-requestors.label: Requestors
Entity-requestors.description: Requestors are users, specifically tactical personnel, who interact with the LCS-Marine system to place supply or information requests and receive notifications about the status of those requests.

Entity-user.label: users
Entity-user.description: Users refer to individuals or stakeholders who interact with the intelligent mobile agents and information sources in the context of the LCS-Marine application.

Entity-human_interaction_with_data_sourc.label: human interaction with data sources
Entity-human_interaction_with_data_sourc.description: Human interaction with data sources refers to the innovative paradigm of engaging users with information systems through spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents, enabling seamless communication and request management for data retrieval and status updates.

Entity-system.label: system
Entity-system.description: The 'system' refers to a logistics management software that allows tactical personnel to interact through spoken language to place supply or information requests and receive notifications about their status.

Entity-several_field_exercise.label: several field exercises
Entity-several_field_exercise.description: Several field exercises refer to practical demonstrations conducted with the Marines to showcase the capabilities of the LCS-Marine application, which integrates spoken language understanding with intelligent mobile agents for logistics management.

Entity-tactical_personnel.label: tactical personnel
Entity-tactical_personnel.description: Tactical personnel refers to military staff, particularly those involved in operational roles, who utilize the LCS-Marine system to interact with logistics for supply and information requests.

Entity-application.label: applications
Entity-application.description: The term 'applications' refers to the various uses and implementations of the Listen-Communicate-Show technology in different domains beyond its initial demonstration with the Marines.

Entity-technology.label: technology
Entity-technology.description: The term 'technology' refers to the innovative application of a spoken language understanding system integrated with intelligent mobile agents designed to facilitate human interaction with data sources, specifically in the context of logistics and military operations.

Entity-spoken_language_understanding_sys.label: spoken language understanding system
Entity-spoken_language_understanding_sys.description: A spoken language understanding system is a technology designed to interpret and process human speech in order to facilitate communication between users and computer systems.

Entity-information_source.label: information sources
Entity-information_source.description: Information sources refer to the various databases and repositories of data that are accessed and utilized by intelligent mobile agents to facilitate user requests in the context of the Listen-Communicate-Show paradigm.

Entity-status.label: status
Entity-status.description: The term 'status' refers to the current state or condition of a request within the LCS-Marine system, indicating whether it has changed or been completed.

Entity-new_domain.label: new domains
Entity-new_domain.description: new domains refers to the various areas of application where the Listen-Communicate-Show technology is being developed and implemented beyond its initial military logistics context.

Entity-appropriate_database.label: appropriate database
Entity-appropriate_database.description: The 'appropriate database' refers to the specific data repository utilized by the LCS-Marine application to process supply or information requests made by tactical personnel.

Entity-domain.label: domains
Entity-domain.description: The term 'domains' refers to new areas of application or fields of study where the technology developed in the paper, specifically the Listen-Communicate-Show paradigm, is being implemented.

Entity-mobile.label: mobile
Entity-mobile.description: The term 'mobile' refers to an intelligent agent that is capable of executing tasks and mediating between users and information sources in a dynamic environment.

Entity-human_interaction.label: human interaction
Entity-human_interaction.description: Human interaction refers to the ways in which individuals communicate and engage with one another, encompassing various forms of social interaction and communication methods.

Entity-logistics_system.label: logistics system
Entity-logistics_system.description: A logistics system is an integrated framework that manages the flow of goods, information, and resources throughout the supply chain to ensure efficient delivery and support of operations.

Entity-intelligent_mobile_agent.label: intelligent mobile agents
Entity-intelligent_mobile_agent.description: Intelligent mobile agents are autonomous software programs that can move across networks to perform tasks on behalf of users, often utilizing artificial intelligence to adapt and respond to their environment.

Entity-database.label: database
Entity-database.description: A database is an organized collection of structured information or data, typically stored electronically in a computer system, that allows for efficient retrieval, management, and updating of the data.

Entity-intelligent_agent.label: intelligent agent
Entity-intelligent_agent.description: An intelligent agent is a software program or system that utilizes artificial intelligence techniques to autonomously perform tasks, make decisions, or solve problems in a given environment.

Entity-data_source.label: data sources
Entity-data_source.description: Data sources are entities or repositories that provide information or data for analysis, research, or decision-making.

Entity-status_of_a_request.label: status of a request
Entity-status_of_a_request.description: The status of a request refers to the current state or progress of a submitted request within a system, indicating whether it is pending, in progress, completed, or has encountered an issue.

Entity-marine.label: Marines
Entity-marine.description: The Marines refer to a branch of the military organization that specializes in amphibious operations and is known for its rapid response capabilities.

Entity-field_exercise.label: field exercises
Entity-field_exercise.description: Field exercises are practical training activities conducted in outdoor environments, often involving military personnel, to simulate real-world scenarios and enhance operational readiness.

summary: Listen-Communicate-Show -LRB- LCS -RRB- is a new paradigm for human interaction with data sources . We integrate a spoken language understanding system with intelligent mobile agents that mediate between users and information sources . We have built and will demonstrate an application of this approach called LCS-Marine . Using LCS-Marine , tactical personnel can converse with their logistics system to place a supply or information request . The request is passed to a mobile , intelligent agent for execution at the appropriate database . Requestors can also instruct the system to notify them when the status of a request changes or when a request is complete . We have demonstrated this capability in several field exercises with the Marines and are currently developing applications of this technology in new domains .

Predicate-is_a_new_paradigm_for.label: is a new paradigm for
Predicate-is_a_new_paradigm_for.description: The predicate 'is a new paradigm for' signifies a transformative approach or framework that redefines the relationship between the subject and the object. It implies that the subject introduces innovative concepts, methods, or practices that significantly alter or enhance the way the object is understood, utilized, or experienced. This connection suggests a shift in perspective or methodology that leads to improved outcomes or insights regarding the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the qualities, characteristics, or essence represented by the object, thereby creating a relationship of definition or classification.

Predicate-integrates_with.label: integrates with
Predicate-integrates_with.description: The predicate 'integrates with' denotes a relationship where the subject and object are combined or coordinated in a way that allows them to function together effectively. This integration implies a mutual enhancement of capabilities, where the subject incorporates elements or functionalities from the object, leading to a more cohesive and efficient system or process.

Predicate-mediate_between.label: mediate between
Predicate-mediate_between.description: The predicate 'mediate between' indicates a facilitative role where the subject acts as an intermediary or connector that enables communication, interaction, or understanding between the subject and the object. It implies that the subject plays a crucial role in bridging gaps, resolving conflicts, or enhancing collaboration between the two entities involved.

Predicate-interact_with.label: interact with
Predicate-interact_with.description: The predicate 'interact with' denotes a reciprocal or mutual engagement between the subject and the object, where the subject actively participates in a process or exchange involving the object. This interaction can involve communication, collaboration, or any form of engagement that influences or is influenced by the object, highlighting a dynamic relationship between the two entities.

Predicate-called.label: called
Predicate-called.description: The predicate 'called' serves to establish a naming relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is referred to or identified by the name provided in the object. It connects the two by asserting that the subject has a specific designation or label, which is represented by the object.

Predicate-is_called.label: is called
Predicate-is_called.description: The predicate 'is called' serves to establish a naming relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is referred to or identified by the name or term represented by the object.

Predicate-can_converse_with.label: can converse with
Predicate-can_converse_with.description: The predicate 'can converse with' indicates the ability of the subject to engage in a communicative exchange with the object. This implies a two-way interaction where information, ideas, or commands can be shared, understood, and responded to, facilitating collaboration or coordination between the entities involved.

Predicate-can_place.label: can place
Predicate-can_place.description: The predicate 'can place' indicates the ability or capacity of the subject to position, assign, or submit the object in a specific context or situation. It suggests that the subject has the necessary authority, resources, or skills to effectively execute the action of placing the object, which may involve organizing, initiating, or facilitating a request, item, or piece of information.

Predicate-is_passed_to.label: is passed to
Predicate-is_passed_to.description: The predicate 'is passed to' indicates a transfer or transmission of an entity from one context or agent to another. It signifies that the subject, which represents an item or piece of information, is being directed or delivered to the object, which typically represents a recipient or a system that will process or act upon the subject.

Predicate-executes_at.label: executes at
Predicate-executes_at.description: The predicate 'executes at' establishes a relationship where the subject performs actions or operations in a specific context or location represented by the object. It indicates that the subject is actively engaged in executing tasks or processes within the environment or system denoted by the object.

Predicate-instruct.label: instruct
Predicate-instruct.description: The predicate 'instruct' denotes an action where the subject imparts knowledge, guidance, or commands to the object, facilitating the object's understanding or execution of a task. It implies a transfer of information or direction from the subject to the object, often with the intention of enabling the object to perform a specific function or behavior.

Predicate-notify.label: notify
Predicate-notify.description: The predicate 'notify' indicates an action where the subject communicates information or alerts to the object. In this context, the subject is responsible for conveying a message or update, while the object is the recipient of that information. This relationship highlights the act of informing or making someone aware of something relevant or important.

Predicate-changes.label: changes
Predicate-changes.description: The predicate 'changes' indicates a transformation or alteration that occurs between the subject and the object. In this context, it signifies that the subject undergoes a modification that affects the state, condition, or attributes of the object. This relationship implies a dynamic interaction where the subject initiates or experiences a shift that is reflected in the object.

Predicate-is_complete.label: is complete
Predicate-is_complete.description: The predicate 'is complete' establishes a relationship between the subject and the object by indicating that the subject has reached a state of fulfillment or finality as defined by the object. It conveys that all necessary components or requirements associated with the subject have been satisfied, resulting in a condition where the subject can be considered whole or finished.

Predicate-can_instruct.label: can instruct
Predicate-can_instruct.description: The predicate 'can instruct' indicates the ability or capacity of the subject to provide guidance, direction, or information to the object. It implies that the subject possesses the knowledge or authority to communicate instructions that the object is expected to follow or implement.

Predicate-demonstrated_in.label: demonstrated in
Predicate-demonstrated_in.description: The predicate 'demonstrated in' indicates that the subject has shown or proven its qualities, effectiveness, or performance through specific instances or contexts represented by the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject's attributes are validated or evidenced by the occurrences or activities described in the object.

Predicate-developing_applications_of.label: developing applications of
Predicate-developing_applications_of.description: The predicate 'developing applications of' signifies the process of creating practical uses or implementations for a given subject in various contexts or fields. It connects the subject, which represents a concept, tool, or system, to the object, which denotes the specific areas or domains where these applications are being realized. This relationship highlights the transformative potential of the subject as it is adapted and utilized to address needs, solve problems, or enhance functionality in the specified object.

Predicate-are_being_developed_in.label: are being developed in
Predicate-are_being_developed_in.description: The predicate 'are being developed in' indicates an ongoing process where the subject is undergoing creation, enhancement, or refinement within the context or framework of the object. It suggests that the subject is actively being worked on or improved in relation to the specified area or field represented by the object.

Predicate-implements.label: implements
Predicate-implements.description: The predicate 'implements' denotes a relationship where the subject actively puts into effect or executes the strategies, methods, or systems represented by the object. It signifies that the subject is responsible for the practical application or realization of the concepts or actions described by the object, thereby establishing a functional connection between the two.

Predicate-is_an_abbreviation_for.label: is an abbreviation for
Predicate-is_an_abbreviation_for.description: The predicate 'is an abbreviation for' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a longer phrase or term, and the object is a shortened form or acronym that encapsulates the meaning of that phrase or term. This connection indicates that the object serves as a concise representation of the subject, often used for ease of reference or communication.

Predicate-is_an_application_of.label: is an application of
Predicate-is_an_application_of.description: The predicate 'is an application of' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a specific instance or implementation that utilizes or derives from the principles, methods, or components represented by the object. It indicates that the subject is a practical use or manifestation of the theoretical or foundational aspects denoted by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject represents a more specific concept or category, and the object represents a more general concept or category that encompasses the subject. This relationship implies that the subject is a subset or a specific instance within the broader category defined by the object.
